Liverpool is expected to strengthen in January given the length of Van Dijk's probable absence and relative lack of cover - Among their list of centre-back targets is Inter Milan's 25-year old Milan Skriniar who almost moved to Spurs in October. [@ESPN]

Jose Mourinho retains an interest in Skriniar and would be open to moving for the 25-year-old either in January or, more likely, next summer. But Liverpool's presence in the market could complicate the picture given the urgency with which they need to find reinforcements. [@ESPN]

Tottenham held lengthy negotiations but failed to find an agreement, with Inter refusing to budge from their £54M asking price and instead opting to sign Joe Rodon from Swansea. [@ESPN]

In early 2020, Jurgen Klopp was presented with a four-man shortlist. The names were Timo Werner, Ismaïla Sarr, Jonathan David, who was impressing at the Belgian side Gent, and Jota. Watford wanted £40m for Sarr, with £20m paid up front with add-ons. #awlfc [@_pauljoyce]

A line of communication had been established with Wolves when they inquired about Rhian Brewster and then Neco Williams. However, discussions would centre on Ki-Jana Hoever, and Jota came out on top. #awlfc [@_pauljoyce]
